TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LatinFont extends DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.TextFontType

summary.para: This class is available in Office 2007 or above.
When the object is serialized out as xml, it's qualified name is a:latin.

remarks.format:
## Remarks [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlnoticeiso.md)]
**latin (Latin Font)**
This element specifies that a Latin font be used for a specific run of text. This font is specified with a typeface attribute much like the others but is specifically classified as a Latin font.
[*Example*: Consider the DrawingML shown below.
```xml <a:r> <a:rPr …> <a:latin typeface="Sample Font"/> </a:rPr> <a:t> Sample Text</a:t> </a:r> ```
The above run of text is rendered using the Latin font "Sample Font". *end example*]
|Parent Elements| |---------------------| |defRPr (§21.1.2.3.2); endParaRPr (§21.1.2.2.3); font (§20.1.4.2.13); majorFont (§20.1.4.1.24); minorFont (§20.1.4.1.25); rPr (§21.1.2.3.9)|
[*Note*: The W3C XML Schema definition of this element’s content model (CT_TextFont) is located in §A.4.1. *end note*]
[!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlcopyrightiso.md)]
